Bidirectional RAG: Safe Self-Improving Retrieval-Augmented Generation Through Multi-Stage Validation

Tech 5 min read

The article discusses Bidirectional Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), a novel approach designed to enhance the safety and accuracy of AI models through multi-stage validation. This technique combines retrieval and generation processes, allowing the model to improve its outputs by cross-referencing external knowledge sources. By integrating bidirectional communication between retrieval and generation, the model can validate information at multiple stages, thus minimizing errors and enhancing safety in its responses. This method aims to address the challenges of hallucination and misinformation in AI-generated content,

Security 5 min read

The blog has become a pivotal independent resource for cybersecurity news, investigations, and insights. Zoom Stealer browser extensions harvest corporate meeting intelligence

AI 5 min read

The article discusses the security threats posed by malicious browser extensions dubbed "Zoom Stealers," which are designed to extract corporate meeting information. These extensions, disguised as legitimate productivity tools, infiltrate web browsers to harvest sensitive data such as meeting schedules, participant details, and recorded video content from virtual meetings. Cybercriminals are leveraging these tools to gain unauthorized access to confidential business information, potentially leading to corporate espionage and financial loss.
